tactics.name: Reconnaissance
tactics.description: The adversary is trying to gather information they can use to plan future operations.

tactics.name: ResourceDevelopment
tactics.description: The adversary is trying to establish resources they can use to support operations.

tactics.name: InitialAccess
tactics.description: The adversary is trying to get into your network.

tactics.name: Execution
tactics.description: The adversary is trying to run malicious code.

tactics.name: Persistence
tactics.description: The adversary is trying to maintain their foothold.

tactics.name: PrivilegeEscalation
tactics.description: The adversary is trying to gain higher-level permissions.

tactics.name: DefenseEvasion
tactics.description: The adversary is trying to avoid being detected.

tactics.name: CredentialAccess
tactics.description: The adversary is trying to steal account names and passwords.

tactics.name: Discovery
tactics.description: The adversary is trying to figure out your environment.

tactics.name: LateralMovement
tactics.description: The adversary is trying to move through your environment.

tactics.name: Collection
tactics.description: The adversary is trying to gather data of interest to their goal.

tactics.name: CommandAndControl
tactics.description: The adversary is trying to communicate with compromised systems to control them.

tactics.name: Exfiltration
tactics.description: The adversary is trying to steal data.

tactics.name: Impact
tactics.description: The adversary is trying to manipulate, interrupt, or destroy your systems and data.

techniques.name: Active Scanning
techniques.description: Adversaries may execute active reconnaissance scans to gather information that can be used during targeting.

techniques.name: Scanning IP Blocks
techniques.description: Adversaries may scan victim IP blocks to gather information that can be used during targeting.

techniques.name: Vulnerability Scanning
techniques.description: Adversaries may scan victims for vulnerabilities that can be used during targeting.

techniques.name: Gather Victim Network Information
techniques.description: Adversaries may gather information about the victim's networks that can be used during targeting.

techniques.name: Obtain Capabilities
techniques.description: Adversaries may buy and/or steal capabilities that can be used during targeting.

techniques.name: Malware
techniques.description: Adversaries may buy, steal, or download malware that can be used during targeting.

techniques.name: Acquire Infrastructure
techniques.description: Adversaries may buy, lease, or rent infrastructure that can be used during targeting.

techniques.name: Domains
techniques.description: Adversaries may acquire domains that can be used during targeting.

techniques.name: Phishing
techniques.description: Adversaries may send phishing messages to gain access to victim systems.

techniques.name: Spearphishing Attachment
techniques.description: Adversaries may send spearphishing emails with a malicious attachment in an attempt to gain access to victim systems.

techniques.name: Spearphishing Link
techniques.description: Adversaries may send spearphishing emails with a malicious link in an attempt to gain access to victim systems.

techniques.name: Spearphishing via Service
techniques.description: Adversaries may send spearphishing messages via third-party services in an attempt to gain access to victim systems.

techniques.name: Exploit Public-Facing Application
techniques.description: Adversaries may attempt to take advantage of a weakness in an Internet-facing computer or program using software, data, or commands in order to cause unintended or unanticipated behavior.

techniques.name: External Remote Services
techniques.description: Adversaries may leverage external-facing remote services to initially access and/or persist within a network.

techniques.name: Valid Accounts
techniques.description: Adversaries may obtain and abuse credentials of existing accounts as a means of gaining Initial Access, Persistence, Privilege Escalation, or Defense Evasion.

techniques.name: Default Accounts
techniques.description: Adversaries may obtain and abuse credentials of a default account as a means of gaining Initial Access, Persistence, Privilege Escalation, or Defense Evasion.

techniques.name: Domain Accounts
techniques.description: Adversaries may obtain and abuse credentials of a domain account as a means of gaining Initial Access, Persistence, Privilege Escalation, or Defense Evasion.

techniques.name: Local Accounts
techniques.description: Adversaries may obtain and abuse credentials of a local account as a means of gaining Initial Access, Persistence, Privilege Escalation, or Defense Evasion.

techniques.name: Cloud Accounts
techniques.description: Adversaries may obtain and abuse credentials of a cloud account as a means of gaining Initial Access, Persistence, Privilege Escalation, or Defense Evasion.

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter
techniques.description: Adversaries may abuse command and script interpreters to execute commands, scripts, or binaries.

techniques.name: PowerShell
techniques.description: Adversaries may abuse PowerShell commands and scripts for execution.

techniques.name: Windows Command Shell
techniques.description: Adversaries may abuse the Windows command shell for execution.

techniques.name: Unix Shell
techniques.description: Adversaries may abuse Unix shell commands and scripts for execution.

techniques.name: Scheduled Task/Job
techniques.description: Adversaries may abuse task scheduling functionality to facilitate initial or recurring execution of malicious code.

techniques.name: Scheduled Task
techniques.description: Adversaries may abuse the Windows Task Scheduler to perform task scheduling for initial or recurring execution of malicious code.

techniques.name: Boot or Logon Autostart Execution
techniques.description: Adversaries may configure system settings to automatically execute a program during system boot or logon to maintain persistence or gain higher-level privileges on compromised systems.

techniques.name: Registry Run Keys / Startup Folder
techniques.description: Adversaries may achieve persistence by adding a program to a startup folder or referencing it with a Registry run key.

techniques.name: Create or Modify System Process
techniques.description: Adversaries may create or modify system-level processes to repeatedly execute malicious payloads as part of persistence.

techniques.name: Windows Service
techniques.description: Adversaries may create or modify Windows services to repeatedly execute malicious payloads as part of persistence.

techniques.name: Process Injection
techniques.description: Adversaries may inject code into processes in order to evade process-based defenses as well as possibly elevate privileges.

techniques.name: Dynamic-link Library Injection
techniques.description: Adversaries may inject dynamic-link libraries (DLLs) into processes in order to evade process-based defenses as well as possibly elevate privileges.

techniques.name: Impair Defenses
techniques.description: Adversaries may maliciously modify components of a victim's defense to avoid detection or aid in their operations.

techniques.name: Disable or Modify Tools
techniques.description: Adversaries may modify and/or disable security tools to avoid possible detection of their malware/tools and activities.

techniques.name: Indicator Removal
techniques.description: Adversaries may delete or modify artifacts generated within systems to remove evidence of their presence or hinder defenses.

techniques.name: Clear Windows Event Logs
techniques.description: Adversaries may clear Windows Event Logs to hide the activity of an intrusion.

techniques.name: Brute Force
techniques.description: Adversaries may use brute force techniques to gain access to accounts when passwords are unknown or when password hashes are obtained.

techniques.name: Password Guessing
techniques.description: Adversaries with no prior knowledge of legitimate credentials within the system or environment may guess passwords to attempt access to accounts.

techniques.name: OS Credential Dumping
techniques.description: Adversaries may attempt to dump credentials to obtain account login and credential material, normally in the form of a hash or a clear text password, from the operating system and software.

techniques.name: LSASS Memory
techniques.description: Adversaries may attempt to access credential material stored in the process memory of the Local Security Authority Subsystem Service (LSASS).

techniques.name: Account Discovery
techniques.description: Adversaries may attempt to get a listing of accounts on a system or within an environment.

techniques.name: Local Account
techniques.description: Adversaries may attempt to get a listing of local system accounts.

techniques.name: Domain Account
techniques.description: Adversaries may attempt to get a listing of domain accounts.

techniques.name: File and Directory Discovery
techniques.description: Adversaries may enumerate files and directories or may search in specific locations of a host or network share for certain information within a file system.

techniques.name: Network Share Discovery
techniques.description: Adversaries may look for folders and drives shared on remote systems as a means of identifying sources of information to gather as a precursor for Collection and to identify potential systems of interest for Lateral Movement.

techniques.name: Remote Services
techniques.description: Adversaries may use Remote Services to access and persist within a network.

techniques.name: Remote Desktop Protocol
techniques.description: Adversaries may use Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP) to laterally move to a connected system.

techniques.name: SMB/Windows Admin Shares
techniques.description: Adversaries may use SMB to interact with file shares, allowing them to move laterally throughout a network.

techniques.name: Archive Collected Data
techniques.description: An adversary may compress and/or encrypt data that is collected prior to exfiltration.

techniques.name: Archive via Utility
techniques.description: Adversaries may use utilities to compress and/or encrypt collected data prior to exfiltration.

techniques.name: Data Staged
techniques.description: Adversaries may stage collected data in a central location or directory prior to Exfiltration.

techniques.name: Application Layer Protocol
techniques.description: Adversaries may communicate using OSI application layer protocols to avoid detection/network filtering by blending in with existing traffic.

techniques.name: Web Protocols
techniques.description: Adversaries may communicate using application layer protocols associated with web traffic to avoid detection/network filtering by blending in with existing traffic.

techniques.name: Exfiltration Over C2 Channel
techniques.description: Adversaries may steal data by exfiltrating it over an existing command and control channel.

techniques.name: Exfiltration Over Web Service
techniques.description: Adversaries may use an existing, legitimate external Web service to exfiltrate data rather than their primary command and control channel.

techniques.name: Data Encrypted for Impact
techniques.description: Adversaries may encrypt data on target systems or on large numbers of systems in a network to interrupt availability to system and network resources.

techniques.name: Inhibit System Recovery
techniques.description: Adversaries may delete or remove built-in data and turn off services designed to aid in the recovery of a corrupted system to prevent recovery.

techniques.name: Service Stop
techniques.description: Adversaries may stop or disable services on a system to render those services unavailable to legitimate users.
